text: [Music]
[Applause]
[Music]
hello my name is tishar a cloud support
engineer here at the aws office in
bangalore today i'm going to talk about
how to troubleshoot could not connect to
the endpoint url arrow while trying to
run the cp or sync command against an
aws simple storage service bucket let's
get started if you get the could not
connect the endpoint url error message
while running the cp or sync commands
using the aws command line interface it
means that your machine cannot connect
to the s3 endpoint there can be multiple
reasons to this problem today let us
explore the four most common reasons
that can lead to this issue first check
in the troubleshooting is to confirm
that you are using the correct aws
region and s3 endpoint to check the
region of your s3 bucket log into your
aws management console
navigate to the s3 console
find the region of the bucket mentioned
next to your bucket name under aws
region section
now the general s3 endpoints are of the
format
bucket name
s3 dot region
amazon aws.com if you're using a normal
s3 api endpoint or a special purpose s3
endpoint such as s3 axis point and point
then the format of this endpoint will
change accordingly
you can refer to the s3 service
endpoints and quotas document for a list
of s3 endpoints to give you an example
let's assume that i have a bucket
created in the region uswest 2 with the
name test bucket kc video if i run the
cp command to copy a file to my bucket
using the following cri command
then it will fail because the endpoint
doesn't match the s3 endpoint format and
the keyword aws is missing from amazon
aws and only amazon is used
the second check is to verify whether
your dns can resolve the s3 endpoint
that's used
you can verify this by using dns
utilities such as dig or ns lookup you
can run the following command to test
dns resolution at your end if this dns
resolution test fails with an error or
doesn't dissolve s3 endpoint to an ip
address then check your dns
configuration before you move to the
next step
the third check is to confirm whether
the network that your system is
connected to can connect to the s3
endpoint this will confirm that your
network's firewall allows traffic to the
s3 endpoints on the port that you're
using for s3 traffic
you can run telnet command to confirm
this
make sure that you use the s3 endpoint
url region and port number that's used
for your connection in this test
if you get any error or connection
timeouts during this step check your
network's firewall for rules that are
blocking traffic to or from s3 endpoint
url and port that's used
the fourth and last check in this
troubleshooting process applies to a
special case which is when you get this
error on an amazon elastic compute cloud
instance to show this i've created an
easy to setup in my aws account
in this case we'll check the vpc
configuration of the vpc that's
associated with this ec2 instance now
depending on whether the cc2 instance is
in a public or private subnet the
parameters to check will change
finishing to instance in public subnet
log in to the aws management console and
then open the ec2 dashboard
select the ec2 instance that you're
using
information about the ec2 instance
appears on the bottom pane
scroll down to the details section and
choose the subnet id with this ec2
instance is created a new page with
subnet details appears
on this page select the subnet so that
subnet details appears in this lower
pane choose the network acl tab on this
logo pane
in the network acl check out bound and
inbound rules for the port that you're
using if the rule is deny then review
and fix nacls for s3 traffic
if the network acl restricts access to a
specific region of amazon s3 ip address
ranges
then specify the allowed region while
running aws cli call using hyphen hyphen
region parameter
for an ec2 instance in private subnet
check whether there is a network address
translation or nat gateway associated
with the route table of the subnet the
nat gateway provisions an internet path
to reach
the s3 endpoint
to check this
log in to the aws management console and
then open the ec2 dashboard if you
aren't already at the ec2 instance page
then choose instances options from left
pane
select the ec2 instance that you're
using information about the ec2 instance
appears on the bottom pane
scroll down to the details section and
then choose the subnet id where this ec2
instance is created a new page with
subnet detail appears
on this page select the subnet so that
the subnet detail appears in the lower
pane choose the route table tab on this
lower pane
the lower pane shows the routable
details along with the routes that are
present in the route table make sure
that the route table has a route to the
nat gateway if the route table has an 80
gateway association then the target
should be nat hyphen star as the default
route that is for the destination
note that the nat gateway must be
created in a public subnet that has its
default route pointed to the internet
gateway
also make sure that the default route is
pointing to an ad gateway that exists
and is in the available state if you're
using a vpc endpoint for amazon s3 make
sure that you're specifying the correct
region in the hyphen hyphen region
parameter this is because vpc endpoints
for amazon s3 are region specific this
means that you must make sure that the
vpc endpoint that's used and the s3
bucket that you're connecting to are in
the same region
thanks for watching and happy cloud
computing from all of us here at aws
[Music]
[Applause]
